messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: new software actually change a lightbulb for you
messages.msgSnippet: Milt loves power!  sucks to hear about your account Rich.  I got an email I don t think it was from you, but I was getting offered a second chance before the
messages.messageBody:
Milt loves power! sucks to hear about your account
Rich. I got an email I don't think it was from you,
but I was getting offered a second chance before the
auction was even over. That was a big clue! Always
go check your emails from ebay through the My ebay
-message center area, if it isn't there it didn't go
through their system. I thought I got a good deal
when I won the auction I wonder if they scared off
bidders?

good luck everyone. Don't forget to send me any
mantis items, It was my b-day yesterday and looks like
I have managed to buy a tsuba, fuchi/kashira, kozuka,
and I will be bidding on a single mantis menuki
today/tomorrow better look. So I almost got a
complete set. Luckily, family comes through with
monetary gifts so the presents I got myself total
price tag has been reduced! I have no control!
actually it is more like 2 tsuba and maybe 2 F/K.
whoops! TO the addicted, I salute you.
Ken Wilson aka "The Mantis Dude"

messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/11/2007 4:16:45 P.M. Central Daylight Time,
ikkanshi@... writes:

I believe there is a feature that requires new members posts to be
approved by the moderators ?, this may solve a few issues ?, at least
only the moderators (Jim and myself) would see them and not the members,
is that correct Jim ?.




if you set all NEW member posting parameter to " moderated ", then you can
get the first crack ........or if old members do not behave, you can set them
to be moderated or not allow to post message.

milt

messages.messageBody:
I believe there is a feature that requires new members posts to be
approved by the moderators ?, this may solve a few issues ?, at least
only the moderators (Jim and myself) would see them and not the members,
is that correct Jim ?.

Best

Rich

> Sorry to divert off topic, but you do realise that these spam messages
> are placed by automated "robots" that browse the net looking for
> forums and emails to automatically register for, and place their spam
> messages?
> These guys never return to view their messages, so changing them in
> any form does nothing at all to deter them. They will never see the
> altered message.
>
> Best to just delete them and carry on.
>
> Brian

messages.subject: Re: new software actually change a lightbulb for you
messages.msgSnippet: Sorry to divert off topic, but you do realise that these spam messages are placed by automated robots that browse the net looking for forums and emails to
messages.messageBody:
Sorry to divert off topic, but you do realise that these spam messages
are placed by automated "robots" that browse the net looking for
forums and emails to automatically register for, and place their spam
messages?
These guys never return to view their messages, so changing them in
any form does nothing at all to deter them. They will never see the
altered message.

Best to just delete them and carry on.

Brian
